Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2009 02:50PM silverlining wrote: Hello Everyone, Add me to your list of chemo starters.  I've started my oral chemo (clinical trial) already (12/31) but will start my taxol x12 on 1/14.  Yippy.  I was dx on 12/16 with IDC, stage 2, no lymph involvement, no lymph-vascular invasion, triple negative.  I had my port placed on 12/30 and had my sentinel lymph node biopsy done as well.  3 nodes were taken and all 3 came back negative.  I'm still getting used to all of this and riding the roller coaster of emotions!! I know what the s/e of taxol are but the unknown and lack of control is what is driving me insane.  I'm doing this as neoadjuvant chemo and I am hoping for complete pathological resolve.  I bought my wig already.  Love it in all honesty.  I have long hair and am still debating as to whether or not to cut my hair short or if I should just shave it off and start wearing the wig.  I know people say that losing hair is the hardest thing.  I'm just scared.  Thank goodness my son (4 mons old) won't know the difference. I'm glad I found you guys and together I know we can all get through this. Janice
Posts.Title: Starting chemo January 2009? lisalisa ktym

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2009 01:41PM - edited Jan 11, 2009 01:42PM by silverlining Hello Ladies, I am unwillingly joining your group.  I was diagnosed with poorly differentiated infiltrating ductal carcinoma on Dec 16th 2008.  I noticed the lump "surface" after my son was born (Aug 22nd) when my milk came in.  My OB/GYN thought, along with me and my PCP, that it was a clogged milk duct -- had all the symptoms of it!!  Well it didn't go away so had it checked out.  When in for a US on 12/12, had a US guided biopsy and FNA on a suspicious lymph node that same afternoon and then waited until the 12/16th.  I have been on a roller coaster since.  In the last 3.5 wks I've had MRI's, PET/CT scans, sentinel lymph node biopsy (3 removed and all 3 were negative) and a port placed.  I am a triple negative and tested negative for BRAC1 and 2.  My husband and I decided that a clinical trial would be good -- want to throw everything we can at this thing.  I started that on the 31st (Happy New year to me) and will start Taxol on 1/14.  Yes we decided to go with neoadjuvant chemo followed by surgery and radiation. I'm so glad I've found you guys.  I've only had one other person who my ONC recommended to speak to (a patient of hers) who was the same age as me (32) with the same dx and is 3 yrs out now and is 5 mons preg!  There is hope :) Thanks for being there for me though silently until now... Janice
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed w/aggressive IDC theredheadamy kim40
